abstract: The inspector general said poor record-keeping made it hard to document decisions in a $71 billion guarantee program for ventures with clean technologies.
snippet: The inspector general said poor record-keeping made it hard to document decisions in a $71 billion guarantee program for ventures with clean technologies.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Poor record-keeping by the Energy Department has made it difficult for managers to document how decisions were reached in its $71 billion loan guarantee program, the department’s inspector general said in an audit released on Monday.

headline.main: Inspector Faults Energy Department Over Loan Program
headline.print_headline: Inspector Says U.S. Kept Poor Data on Energy Loans
